content.help: Enable or disable this mod. Default: OFF
Displays a warning at the start of a game when this mod is disabled. Default: ON

content.text:
Periodic updates: Checks rads every x seconds (update delay) and changes morphs according to current rads level.
Update after sleeping: Every time you go to sleep you get additional morphs according to the current rads. In this update mode you can only restore your body by visiting a doctor.

content.help: Whether to update periodically or only after sleeping. Default: Periodically
Seconds to wait between updating morphs. Only applies to periodic updates. Default: 1s
Determine radiation from actual radiation value (red part of the health bar) or by using a random rads/s value while taking rads in game. Default: Actual radiation
With random rads detection, rads/s will be between this value and the upper limit when taking rads. Total rads go from 0 to 1000.
With random rads detection, rads/s will be between the lower limit and this value when taking rads. Total rads go from 0 to 1000.
Resets the mod to its initial state without restoring the original body. Does not change any settings.
Add 50 irradiated blood to player inventory for rads testing.

content.text: Irradiated Perk, Applies Stat Buffs/Debuffs Based on Rads

content.help: Irradiated perk progression speed based on %Rads. Default: Custom

content.text: Custom Irradiated Stage %'s: Custom points at which the Irradiated perk increases in rank. Set a slider to 100% to disable that stage and later stages.

content.help: Sets the point at which the first stage Irradiated perk is added. Default: 100
Sets the point at which the second stage Irradiated perk is added. Default: 100
Sets the point at which the third stage Irradiated perk is added. Default: 100
Sets the point at which the fourth stage Irradiated perk is added. Default: 100
Sets the point at which the final stage Irradiated perk is added. Default: 100

content.text:
To find the correct slider names open the XML file relevant to the body you are using in Bodyslide's "SliderCategories" folder.
The attribute "displayname" is what you see in BodySlide, but here you need to enter the value of the "name" attribute.

content.help: Show the worn clothing / armor items and their slots
Enter the slider names separated by "|" (e.g. Boobs|Butt|Nose). Make sure there is no leading or trailing space.
At 100% the slider will be the initial value + 1 when you are fully irradiated.
Morphing starts when you are irradiated for x%
Morphing reaches the target size increase when you are irradiated for x%
Enter slot numbers to unequip when the unequip threshold is reached. Separate multiple slots by "|" (e.g. 10|11|12). Make sure there is no leading or trailing space.
When x% of your morphing target is reached armor from the selected slots will be unequipped.
With this enabled only doctors can restore your base shape. Reducing rads with RadAway or other means will have no effect on the sliders.
Enabled: rads gained after taking RadAway further increase morphs. Disabled: rads gained after taking RadAway only increase morphs if irradiation is higher than before taking RadAway.
Disabled: Unlimited additive morphing. Use at own risk!
How far additive morphing can exceed the target size increase (% of target size increase). 0 = cannot exceed target; 100 = cannot exceed 2x target

content.text: Warning! Additive morphing without a limit can lead to insane morphs!

content.help: Applies this slider set to your companions (based on your rads).

content.text: Warning! Additive morphing without a limit can lead to insane morphs!

content.help: Applies this slider set to your companions (based on your rads).

content.text:
To find the correct slider names open the XML file relevant to the body you are using in Bodyslide's "SliderCategories" folder.
The attribute "displayname" is what you see in BodySlide, but here you need to enter the value of the "name" attribute.

content.help: Show the worn clothing / armor items and their slots
Enter the slider names separated by "|" (e.g. Boobs|Butt|Nose). Make sure there is no leading or trailing space.
At 100% the slider will be the initial value + 1 when you are fully irradiated.
Morphing starts when you are irradiated for x%
Morphing reaches the target size increase when you are irradiated for x%
Enter slot numbers to unequip when the unequip threshold is reached. Separate multiple slots by "|" (e.g. 10|11|12). Make sure there is no leading or trailing space.
When x% of your morphing target is reached armor from the selected slots will be unequipped.
With this enabled only doctors can restore your base shape. Reducing rads with RadAway or other means will have no effect on the sliders.
Enabled: rads gained after taking RadAway further increase morphs. Disabled: rads gained after taking RadAway only increase morphs if irradiation is higher than before taking RadAway.
Disabled: Unlimited additive morphing. Use at own risk!
How far additive morphing can exceed the target size increase (% of target size increase). 0 = cannot exceed target; 100 = cannot exceed 2x target

content.text: Warning! Additive morphing without a limit can lead to insane morphs!
